question: It is a student-scientist connect programme launched by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) in coordination with Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS). The programme aims to connect school students with research scientists to boost laboratory-based learning. It is inculcating in students the culture of inquisitiveness on one hand and scientific temper on the other. The name of the programme is _?
explanation: Jigyasa is a student- scientist connect programme. It was officially launched by the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) in coordination with Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan (KVS). It focuses on connecting school students and scientists so as to extend student’s classroom learning with that of a very well planned research laboratory based learning. The programme is inspired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s vision of a new India and “Scientific Social Responsibility (SSR)” of scientific community and institutions. It is inculcating in students the culture of inquisitiveness on one hand and scientific temper on the other. It is expected to connect 1151 Kendriya Vidyalaya with 38 National Laboratories of CSIR targeting 100,000 students and nearly 1000 teachers annually.
